data.label:
Narrator

My motorcade traveled for over an hour before the Archsanctuary of Plavo appeared just over the horizon.

Narrator

It was a view I’d seen countless times, but it never failed to inspire awe.

Narrator

It was a view that inspired awe in many a Rizian, especially the most devout followers of St. Wruhec.

Narrator

Titus, who was sitting next to the driver, turned back to me.

Narrator

Not even my father, despite my asking, would disclose what occurred. He would simply say, “What took place was between me and God.”

Narrator

But aside from the pomp and circumstance of the Consecration of the King, this meeting was my chance to catch up on Rizia's current state of religious affairs.

Player_Romus

"Grand Wiseman Ignacius... Looking as stoic as ever."

Player_Romus

"Look at the old geezer. Hard to believe he's still breathing."

Player_Romus

"Here we go."

Narrator

A welcoming smile spread across the Grand Wiseman's face as he came down the stairs to greet me.

Player_Romus

"I shall honor this day with the dignity and respect this sacred tradition deserves."

Sal Ignacius

“It fills my heart with joy to hear it.”

Player_Romus

“Time is short, Grand Wiseman. Let us skip the pleasantries."

Player_Romus

"And I am privileged to receive your guidance.”

Sal Ignacius

"I'm merely a humble servant, Your Grace. I do as God commands."

Sal Ignacius

“The six stars of St. Wruhec still shine upon our nation."

Narrator

We began heading toward the entrance. However, I didn't get very far before my attention was drawn to a commotion from behind.

Player_Romus_Italic

I didn't want to be seen as a coward, so I stood my ground as the man approached.

Player_Romus_Italic

I hurried towards the archsanctuary before he could reach me.

Narrator

Titus, without missing a beat, caught the man by the arm and threw him to the ground.

Player_Romus

"What's so blasphemous about it?"

Player_Romus

“And so you banned them. Rightly so, I might add."

Player_Romus

“Could we not have built Golcondist sanctuaries to pacify them?”

Narrator

With a nod from Captain Gordion, two of his guardsmen lifted the man to his feet and escorted him away.

Sal Ignacius

“Shall we proceed?”

Player_Romus

“Yes. The sooner we get this over with, the better.”

Player_Romus

“How could I say no?"

Player_Romus

"Just point me in the right direction."

Narrator

I accompanied Sal into the archsanctuary. Titus and one of his men stood guard at the entrance.

Narrator

Our footsteps echoed throughout the massive empty chamber as we made our way down the main aisle, separating the hall in two.

Player_Romus

“I remember the archsanctuary being a lot bigger.”

Player_Romus

“One could get lost in a place like this.”

Player_Romus

“All spectacle. No sustenance.”

Sal Ignacius

"Some might say, spiritual sustenance comes from within."

Sal Ignacius

"Credited for single-handedly spreading the teachings of St. Wruhec throughout the kingdom, he's considered Rizia’s most revered disciple."

Player_Romus

"As long as you are Grand Wiseman, I am sure that those values will persevere."

Player_Romus

"The Dastnurists are particularly concerning, as they place exclusive reliance on the scripture of St. Dast, disregarding centuries of progress since Descension Day."

Player_Romus

"The Golcondists pose a particularly large threat, using Wruhecism as a cover for blasphemy."

Player_Romus

"The Wehzeks endured immense suffering during the civil war, and I wouldn't deny them the right to find solace in their religion."

Sal Ignacius

"However, he was too preoccupied with other matters to sign the order."

Player_Romus

“More proof that church and state should be separate entities."

Player_Romus

"That's unacceptable; I can't believe I'm only finding out about this now."

Player_Romus

"Maybe he didn't think that Plavo was worth saving.”

Sal Ignacius

“I recently received an urgent request from the Archpriest of Sallabes. That city's Dastnurist sanctuary has long been insufficient to serve worshippers' needs, and he requests that a new one be constructed."

Player_Romus

"We should give the Dastnurists their sanctuary, as every inhabitant of Rizia should have a dedicated space for religious practice."

Player_Romus

“Can't they worship in the same sanctuaries as Wruhecists?"

Player_Romus

"We can't just roll out the welcome mat to Dastnurity without considering where it might lead."

Player_Romus

"I can tell you right away, I want to restore the Archsanctuary of Plavo."

Sal Ignacius

“A most wise decision, Your Majesty. May God’s shining light forever guide you even through the darkest times.”

Narrator

The Grand Wiseman's eyes lit up.

Narrator

The holy man let out a small gasp.

Narrator

I followed the Grand Wiseman down a long corridor.

Sal Ignacius

"This way, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

“I had no idea this was down here.”

Sal Ignacius

"This way, Your Grace."

Narrator

As we made our way down the tunnel, the ceiling began to close in around us, and feelings of claustrophobia began to sink in.

Narrator

They were arranged around a marble sarcophagus.

Player_Romus

“Is that who I think it is?"

Sal Ignacius

"Rare are those who have set foot here. Count yourself among the blessed few."

Player_Romus

“I am ready.”

Player_Romus

"Whatever you say."

Player_Romus

“Actually... I'm beginning to have second thoughts."

Narrator

Following the Grand Wiseman's instructions, I joined him in reciting verses from the sacred scripture.

Narrator

When my garments were completely removed, Sal proceeded to anoint me, dipping a sponge into the fragrant oil and gently applying it all over my body.

Narrator

He then poured the wine into the chalice until it reached the brim.

Sal Ignacius

"For you see, once consumed, Caelus the Devout's gift of foresight shall, for a time, be bestowed upon the person who ingests it."

Narrator

But then suddenly, his body began to tremble and his hands took a firm grip in mine.

Sal Ignacius

"Listen closely to my words. For the gift of sight comes in flashes."

Player_Romus_Italic

I closed my eyes as well.

Player_Romus_Italic

I pulled my hands away from him.

Sal Ignacius

"To consummate the Consecration of the King I must insist that you take my hands."

Player_Romus

"Nobody told me there would be prophecies. I cannot rule with the weight of future events hanging over my head."

Narrator

I quickly put on my clothes, and made my way back through the catacombs until I'd reached the surface.

Narrator

Titus and another guardsman were at my side the moment they saw me re-emerge.

Titus Gordion

"Your Majesty, is everything alright?"

Player_Romus

"Yes. We just have to go."

Player_Romus

"Get out of my way, Captain. Do you want to be demoted to private?"

Narrator

I thought about the Grand Wiseman's last words to me as the Archsanctuary of Plavo faded from view.

Narrator

Before long, my motorcade was back on the road.

Narrator

By the time I'd made it back to the car, the captain was so far behind, I ended up opening the door myself.

Narrator

At his advanced age, he wasn't exactly spry.

Sal Ignacius

"Can't say the same for myself. These old bones don't move as quickly as they used to."

Sal Ignacius

"Oh, I may be old, but I'm not dead yet."

Player_Romus

"I'll be the judge of that."

Narrator

He closed his eyes and began taking in long deep breaths.

Sal Ignacius

"I see a crown. It's ascending into the sky... rising high above the surrounding countryside--"

Player_Romus

"I know this may seem highly unorthodox, but this whole secret ceremony just doesn't sit well with me."

Player_Romus

"I must break with the archaic customs of the past if I am to be the ruler Rizia needs right now."

Sal Ignacius

"A sovereign leader of this great nation, it is your duty to uphold this sacred tradition, just as all the monarchs who came before you."

Sal Ignacius

"For to reject the sacrament is to reject God himself."

Player_Romus

"Religion's place in our society is without question. But as for its role in government... I have reservations."

Narrator

The wiscerer went silent. Though he outwardly remained calm, the disdain in his eyes told a different story.

Player_Romus

"No... I don't believe it's in the Crown's interest to fund either project."

Sal Ignacius

"With all due respect to the Golden Guard."

Sal Ignacius

"Wruhecism and the Rizian monarchy are one and the same. It has been that way since the beginning."

Narrator

Sal gasped in astonishment as I made an about-face and headed back towards the catacombs.

Narrator

I could still smell the "holy oil" permeating off of me.

Sal Ignacius

"Does this mean you'll go through with the consecration?"

Player_Romus

"If that's what it takes to get your blessing, then yes."

Player_Romus

"No, but since I did agree to reallocating funds toward the Archsanctuary of Plavo as well as the Dastnurist Grand Sanctuary, perhaps we can overlook my abstention?"

Player_Romus

"This was a one time agreement. Be grateful you got any concessions at all."

Narrator

I wished Wiseman Ignacius goodbye and left the premises. Captain Gordion and his men followed behind.

Narrator

As my motorcade traveled down the highway, and the Archsacturary of Plavo faded from view, I felt pleased at all I had accomplished today.

Sal Ignacius

"Very well then. I will, of course, remain hopeful that you'll have a change of heart."

Narrator

I wished Wiseman Ignacius goodbye and left the premises. Captain Gordion and his men followed behind.

Narrator

As my motorcade traveled down the highway, and the Archsacturary of Plavo faded from view, I felt pleased at all I had accomplished today.

Sal Ignacius

"Then please, let us proceed."

Sal Ignacius

"If I may give you a piece of advice..."

Player_Romus

"Fine. But hurry it up. I haven't got all day."

Player_Romus

"You forget your place, Grand Wiseman. The onus lies not on the king to seek favor with others, but rather, it is the others who should seek favor with the king."

Player_Romus

"Duly noted. I will take my leave. Good day."

Sal Ignacius

"Heavens no! I'm simply saying... tread carefully."

Player_Romus

"Alright. Let us proceed."

Sal Ignacius

"Well, in any case, I'm glad you're here."

Sal Ignacius

"Don't let my physical frailty fool you, Your Majesty. For the grace of God gives me unimaginable strength."

Player_Romus

"As he does with me."

Titus Gordion

"With pleasure."

Sal Ignacius

"What?! But my king, you must."

Player_Romus

"My most sincere apologies."

Player_Romus

"I mean no offense."

Player_Romus

"I'm not going to repeat myself."

Player_Romus

"I'm sorry, but I can't. This is too much."

Sal Ignacius

"And on the crown is a fracture on the golden band..."

Sal Ignacius

"The higher it journeys upward, the larger the crack gets."

Player_Romus

"What else do you see?"

Player_Romus

"Go on."

Sal Ignacius

"I now see soldiers... Many soldiers... War... And death. So much death."

Player_Romus

"War with whom?"

Player_Romus

"Whose soldiers? Are they ours?"

Player_Romus

"And the victor?"

Narrator

I continued to listen closely to his words.

Player_Romus

"What else does God have in store for me?"

Player_Romus

"The death of a lover, perhaps?"

Player_Romus

"A heart being stabbed by a sword? This is starting to sound like utter nonsense."

Sal Ignacius

"Now, I behold an endless sea of people stretching as far as the eye can see... They are marching toward the royal palace... in joy or anger... I can not say for sure."

Player_Romus

"As it stands, Rizian lands are ruled under three different flags... Wehlen, The Grand Duchy of Pales, and our own... That could be the meaning..."

Player_Romus

"Alright. I've heard enough of this bullshit. Let me go."

Narrator

I felt Sal loosen his hold of me, letting go.

Player_Romus

"I think I understand."

Narrator

A part of me questioned whether or not what I'd experienced was real."

Sal Ignacius

"I don't have the answer you're looking for. It's now up to you to decipher their meaning. That's the gift and the curse that comes with the divine right of the king."

Narrator

Before long, I was back on the road again -- back to reality.

Narrator

At the heart of the room stood a circle of six columns, each bearing a single star delicately carved upon them.

Narrator

And if they were, what my next steps should be.

Narrator

Security guards held back a crowd of onlookers gathered along either side of the stairway leading up to the archsanctuary, where the Grand Wiseman stood.

Titus Gordion

"Indeed. He is a great man."

Titus Gordion

"Good luck, sir."

Titus Gordion

"Divus zaitu!"

Player_Romus

"Please keep your religion to yourself."

Player_Romus

"A religious man, are you? Interesting..."

Player_Romus

"I didn't ask for your opinion."

Player_Romus

"I'm pleased to know that our opinions align."

Player_Romus

"I couldn't agree more. As long as his loyalty remains steadfast."

Titus Gordion

"Forgive me. I meant no offense."

Player_Romus

"Excuse my bluntness. I apologize if I offended you."

Sal Ignacius

"You are too kind."

Sal Ignacius

"As you wish."

Sal Ignacius

"I have no doubt."

Sal Ignacius

"After today, it shall be you who speaks for the Divine."

Sal Ignacius

"As the Lord's representative on earth, I expect nothing less."

Sal Ignacius

"I have. More than once."

Sal Ignacius

"That's because you used to be a lot smaller. Memories of you first learning to walk are as vivid in my mind as if they were yesterday."

Sal Ignacius

"Indeed it does. I've been here more times that I can remember and I still get choked up sometimes."

Player_Romus

"Don't remind me."

Narrator

I suddenly recalled how overjoyed I was seeing Vina take her first steps.

Player_Romus

"How time flies."

Sal Ignacius

"However, there are those who need a little spectacle to ignite that internal spark. This magnificent sanctuary serves that purpose."

Sal Ignacius

"That is of course worrying, Your Majesty."

Sal Ignacius

"Indeed, Your Majesty."

Sal Ignacius

"I doubt that, Your Majesty. Your father was a very devout man, especially at the end of his life."

Sal Ignacius

"I'm surprised you hadn't."

Sal Ignacius

"So you'll go through with the ceremony?"

Player_Romus

"Yes, though I still have reservations."

Player_Romus

"Yes, I will."

Sal Ignacius

"Very good, Your Majesty."

Sal Ignacius

"'Not go through with it?' But you have to!"

Player_Romus

"I know where we are."

Sal Ignacius

"Indeed, Your Majesty. This is the tomb of Caelus the Devout."

Sal Ignacius

"A most vicious foe. More than that, I cannot say."

Sal Ignacius

"One of the armies, yes. Their uniforms carry the royal seal."

VisionHub1

VisionHub1

Sal Ignacius

"One of them is of your blood."

Sal Ignacius

"Or arrangement."

VisionHub2

VisionHub2

Player_Romus

"'Union,' as in marriage?"

Sal Ignacius

"It's a forbidden love or one of disapproval."

Player_Romus

"Lovers? Go on..."

Player_Romus

"This is fascinating. Tell me more."

Sal Ignacius

"They are surrounded by people both for and against their union."

Sal Ignacius

"Perhaps..."

Sal Ignacius

"Possibly."

Sal Ignacius

"I can assure you, Your Grace, my visions are anything *but* nonsense."

Sal Ignacius

"If true, it could mean dark clouds on the horizon are fast approaching."

Sal Ignacius

"It very well could."

Narrator

The Grand Wiseman let out a sigh. He was obviously disappointed by my decision.

Narrator

The Grand Wiseman clapped his hands together.

Titus Gordion

"We'll take it from here, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"Well done, Captain. Take him away."

Player_Romus

"It seems I misjudged you after all, Captain Gordion. You have my thanks."

Player_Romus

"Oh, now you'll 'take it from here?' He should have never broken through your men in the first place."

Player_Romus

"What? Did you expect me to handle it myself?"

Titus Gordion

"It is my honor. My men will deal with this rogue accordingly."

Player_Romus

"Was that man who I think he was?"

Player_Romus

"Can't say I cared for that little stunt, but I do wonder what the man wanted."

Sal Ignacius

"I believe he was a Derdian Golcondist. He was wearing their traditional garb."

Sal Ignacius

"Judging by his wardrobe, he appeared to be a Derdian Golcondist."

Sal Ignacius

"He was a Derdian Golcondist. I'd say his motivation was clear."

Sal Ignacius

"This is one of the holiest places in all of Wruhecism. A belief that the Golcondists *claim* to follow."

Sal Ignacius

"There was a time when Golcondists prayed here in such small numbers that their presence was tolerated."

Narrator

We continued towards the archsanctuary's entrance.

Sal Ignacius

"Apart from the Golcondists, we have seen a rising Dastnurist minority due to the growing numbers of Wehzek migrants."

Player_Romus

"Fascinating. I'd love to hear more about them."

Player_Romus

"No time to bother with corpses. We've got a ceremony to perform."

Sal Ignacius

"We shouldn't delay the ceremony much longer."

Player_Romus_Italic

I gestured to the first tomb.

Player_Romus_Italic

I gestured to the third tomb.

Sal Ignacius

"Very well."

Narrator

In an adjacent room, there were several tombs, each adorned with intricate decorations.

Sal Ignacius

"Here lies Bredus Azaro, the first Duke of Montaklar. All members of the Royal House of Azaro are descended from him."

Sal Ignacius

"Thanks to the funds that are now being put towards repairs, poor Bredus can finally be re-laid to rest."

Sal Ignacius

"That would be the tomb of Talerius Azaro. Not only was he the Earl of Havas, he was the most revered general during the War of Rizian Succession."

Narrator

His mentioning of Camp Domus flooded my mind with fond memories of my time there as a young recruit.

Player_Romus

"Yes, I'm quite familiar with his reputation."

Player_Romus

"Even though he fought against House Toras, I still hold him in the highest respect."

Player_Romus

"He may be revered by some, but I never much cared for him."

Sal Ignacius

"That would be Aurelia Itxaro. If you remember your history, he was the famed industrialist of the 19th Century whose revolutionary mining equipment led to the Second Rizian Gold Rush, creating an economic boom for the entire country."

Sal Ignacius

"He single-handedly brought incomprehensible wealth to this kingdom overnight, granting us enduring power and influence."

Narrator

He paused with his hand on the door.

Narrator

Partway up the stairs, I heard Titus and his men apprehending the assailant. Sal hobbled up behind me, panting.

Player_Romus

"Is that where you keep the torch-ure chamber?"

Narrator

Though I wished I'd been given more insight on what to expect, I respected my father's vow of secrecy and didn't press the issue further.

Player_Romus_Italic

I encouraged the crowd to cheer even louder by raising my hand in the air like the conductor of the Rizian Royal Symphony.

Player_Romus_Italic

I ignored them and kept my head down.

Narrator

Eager to follow along, they got louder the higher my hand raised, and quieter when I brought it down low.

Narrator

The onlooker's enthusiasm began to diminish as I dismissively made my way past. They clearly had expected a show.

Player_Romus_Italic

I gave a royal wave to the crowd.

Player_Romus_Italic

"Laeteum cordeplenum quivoson Desiranto!"

IntruderTakenAway

IntruderTakenAway

IsEverythingAlright

IsEverythingAlright

IFollowedtheWiscerer

IFollowedtheWiscerer

DownTunnelHub

DownTunnelHub

Narrator

Titus quickly exited the vehicle and opened my side door.

Titus Gordion

"These people look like they could give you trouble. Shall I have them removed?"

Player_Romus

"Yes, have them removed immediately; their actions are completely inappropriate."

Titus Gordion

"Yes, Your Majesty."

Titus Gordion

"Of course. Right away."

Titus Gordion

"Yes, sir."

Narrator

I turned back toward the crowd, who continued to watch my every move.

Titus Gordion

"Understood."

Narrator

He cast an intimidating glare over the protesters as we passed them.

Narrator

He cast an intimidating glare over the protesters as we passed them.

Narrator

Captain Gordion quietly spoke to several nearby guards who immediately jumped into action and began herding the protesters away.

Player_Romus

"How morbidly disturbing."

Player_Romus

"Impressive to say the least."

Player_Romus

"I'm tempted to knock to see if anyone's home."

Narrator

Despite my apprehension, I took his hands.

Player_Romus

"Fine. I'll do it. The sooner we get this over with the better."

Player_Romus

"Then I sincerely hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me."

Sal Ignacius

"You only just inherited the throne -- an appointment that comes with the greatest of responsibilities -- so allow me to offer you some advice..."

Player_Romus

"Fine. But keep it brief."

Player_Romus

"*Unsolicited* advice. But do go on. I want to hear what you have to say."

Sal Ignacius

"In my opinion... unsolicited advice, more often than not, offers fresh perspectives and ideas to a recipient that they might not have considered before..."

Sal Ignacius

"Of course."

Sal Ignacius

"But I digress. What I wanted to say was..."

Narrator

Wary as I was, I relented and did as he requested.

Narrator

I put on my clothes, and made my way back through the catacombs until I'd reached the surface -- the events of today, forever burned in my memory.

Player_Romus

"Why do you need my hands?"

Player_Romus

"What's this about?"

Player_Romus

"What are you doing?"

Player_Romus

"Kindly keep your distance."

Player_Romus

"Umm... what are you doing?"

Player_Romus

"What's going on?"

Player_Romus

"No, I haven't changed my mind about that. However... perhaps we can overlook my abstention?"

Player_Romus

"What if I told you I could make it worth your while?"

Player_Romus

"What if I told you there would be consequences for defying the king's wishes?"

Player_Romus

"A man with convictions... It's a rarity these days. I respect that. Until next time."

Sal Ignacius

"Divus zaitu."

Sal Ignacius

"Next time, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"Divus zaitu."

Player_Romus

"Whatever you say."

Player_Romus

"Thanks."

Player_Romus

"You're right. Forget what I said. 'Til next time."

Player_Romus

"Can't say the same about you."

Sal Ignacius

"Make no mistake... In matters of upholding principles, my resolve remains steadfast. However, keeping an open mind through curiosity and skepticism lies at the heart of Wruhecism."

Player_Romus

"Meaning?"

Player_Romus

"I see what you're getting at... In any case, I look forward to speaking to you one-on-one at a later date. Perhaps, by then, I can convince you to expand your curiosity further."

Sal Ignacius

"We shall see."

Sal Ignacius

"As I with you."

Sal Ignacius

"That I may be old, but I know which way to move when the wind blows."

Sal Ignacius

"I look forward to speaking more about this with you at a later date."

Narrator

However, my tense interaction with the grand wiseman left me feeling ill at ease. Having bad blood between us wasn't good for anyone.

Narrator

As my motorcade traveled down the highway, and the Archsacturary of Plavo faded from view, I felt satisfied at all I had accomplished today.

Player_Romus

"Good to hear. I underestimated you, Your Holiness."

Player_Romus

"I don't want to be around someone who is so easily swayed. Forget it."

Player_Romus

"Very good. I look forward to future *arrangements* between us."

Sal Ignacius

"Most do."

Sal Ignacius

"As do I."

Player_Romus

"As long as the wind continues to blow in the right direction."

Narrator

I wished Wiseman Ignacius goodbye and left the premises. Captain Gordion and his men followed behind.

Sal Ignacius

"Well, I'm sorry to hear that. However, in the future, I suggest not being so quick to slam the door shut when opportunities present themselves."

Sal Ignacius

"Go on..."

Player_Romus

"Meaning, I won't feel the need to seek *alternatives* to convince you to being more compliable."

Player_Romus

"As in... you keep your appointment to grand wiseman and aren't replaced by someone more... agreeable."

Player_Romus

"That if you do me this one small favor, another small favor will be returned to you should the time come."

Sal Ignacius

"Do what you must. But I stand on the side of riotousness. The only convincing you need isn't from me, but from God. And he isn't so easily swayed."

Sal Ignacius

"Now, now... let's not be hasty. You wouldn't want to do anything that might disrupt the delicate balance between us."

Sal Ignacius

"If you insist. However, if you get a knock back, I'd suggest we vacate this place as soon as humanly possible."

Sal Ignacius

"Indeed it is."

Sal Ignacius

"Our departed friends won't be coming back to life anytime soon, in case you were worried."

Sal Ignacius

"No, that would be the soprano section of the Wruhecist Tabernacle Choir. They're absolutely awful. But come..."

Player_Romus

"What's down there?"

Player_Romus

"I'm going to catch the plague, I know it."

Player_Romus

"How medieval."

Sal Ignacius

"Come and see for yourself."

Sal Ignacius

"Believe me, this is only the beginning."

Player_Romus

"I'm sorry. As much as I'd like to help, the treasury currently lacks the additional funds."

Sal Ignacius

"That's unfortunate to hear, but perfectly understandable. Those are matters we can discuss at a later date when the Crown has more financial flexibility."

Sal Ignacius

"I'm sorry to hear that. We can address those issues in the future when the Crown's financial situation is more adaptable. I'm confident I can alleviate any concerns you might have."

Narrator

We eventually reached an imposing iron door. Behind it was a descending spiral staircase illuminated by torches mounted on the walls.

Player_Romus

"Who's in the coffin?"

Player_Romus

“Sounds like a waste of money to me."

Narrator

Decorated in gold, I would have considered it the most splendid of all if not for the hole in the lid, through which I could catch a glimpse of the skeletal remains within.

Player_Romus

"I'm ready to move on."

Sal Ignacius

"Splendid! Then let us proceed."

Player_Romus

"What would a Derdian Golcondist be doing here?"

Narrator

Dastnurity was the other main branch of the Nurist religion, observed in most countries to our north -- including both Wehlen and Rumburg.

Sal Ignacius

"Come. It is time you saw what they did to this very building. "

Player_Romus

"I have my own ways of honoring God. This is not one of them."

Player_Romus

"Well, there's a first time for everything."

Narrator

I hoped our little row could be rectified, but I'd until then, I would prepare for any eventuality.

Narrator

Sal had put me in a delicate position. While there was an upside to supporting such projects, particularly in terms of public perception, I also saw the potential downsides.

Narrator

Sal closed his eyes and tilted his head up slightly and awaited my response.

Narrator

I looked closely at the protesters. One was waving a sign that read, "Golcondism Is Not Blasphemy."

Player_Romus

"Demanding entrance to our sacred Wruhecist space... I hope he gets what's coming to him."

Player_Romus

"I didn't know Derdia's fundamentalism had gotten this out of control."

Sal Ignacius

"It is not 'freedom' that motivates these men, but blood lust."

Sal Ignacius

"Alas, our Derdian brothers have strayed far from God's path."
